name: Globalization Is Over
description:
# A Short, Bittersweet Tale of Globalization


Once upon a time, the world was a patchwork of isolated villages. Then came the Age of Discovery, and ships began to weave these patches together with threads of trade and culture. By the 19th century, steam engines and telegraphs stitched the world tighter, ushering in the first golden age of globalization.

But the fabric was fragile. World War I tore through it, and the Great Depression unraveled the rest. By World War II, global trade had shrunk to a fraction of its former potential—a level never to be recaptured.

After the war, nations strove to mend the tapestry. Institutions like the IMF and World Bank acted as new spools, gathering the scattered threads, and trade flourished once again. However, by the early 21st century, the seams began to strain under the weight of inequality and mounting discontent.

Then came Donald Trump, wielding scissors labeled

With decisive snips, he cut into trade agreements, imposed tariffs, and declared a national emergency to protect American workers. His actions frayed alliances and carved gaps that other global players hurried to fill.

And so, the world watched as the once-vibrant quilt of globalization transformed into a patchy, weathered blanket—warm in places yet pierced by cold drafts. Even as memories of unity echo in the threads of the past, the future remains unwritten. With each new twist and turn, the next chapter of our global story is left open—waiting for us to shape it anew.

The journey continues... and only time will reveal where the threads lead.
